column1: Scientific or technical assistant (f/div/m) in Synthetic Biology or...;The Leibniz Institute for Natural Product Research and Infection Biology - Hans Knöll Institute - (Leibniz-HKI
column2: www.leibniz-hki.de/en/) investigates the pathobiology of human-pathogenic fungi and identifies targets for the development of novel natural product-based antibiotics. Talented and highly qualified candidates are invited to apply for a position in the Department Bio Pilot Plant as a Scientific or technical assistant (f/div/m) in Synthetic Biology or Biotechnology for one year initially. Research Areas: Molecular Biology
column4: Biotechnology
column5: Dictyostelium discoideum This project is part of a Federal Ministry for Education and Research (BMBF) funded research project which aims to develop the social amoeba Dictyostelium discoideum into a production platform for secondary metabolites of pharmaceutical importance. The field of study: The successful candidate will assist in the construction of multi-gene expression plasmids and the establishment of CRISPR/Cas tools for strain engineering of the social amoeba Dictyostelium discoideum and will help to develop methods to measure and enhance the production of heterologous secondary metabolites. The main topics of the project may include: Metabolic engineering of D. discoideum to enhance the production of biochemical precursors for polyketide production High-throughput cultivations
column6: automated screening and processing of production strains of D. discoideum Required Qualifications: A bachelor or master degree in molecular biology
column9: biotechnology or related discipline. Candidates about to obtain their degree are welcome to apply. A basic experimental background in molecular cloning and microbiology. The candidate should be highly interested in applied
column10: translational research and able to work in an international
column11: interdisciplinary research team. We offer: The successful candidate will be part of the ProDICAN research project led by Prof. Dr. Falk Hillmann. The aim of the group is to conduct innovative
column12: cutting-edge research on amoebae as a new host organism for the production of plant-derived natural products. The Leibniz-HKI is embedded in the outstanding scientific environment of the Beutenberg Campus providing state-of-the-art research facilities and a highly integrative network of life science groups. We offer a multifaceted scientific project with excellent technical facilities

column1: Scientific or technical assistant / (f/div/m) in Synthetic Biology or...;"Job Advertisement Leibniz-HKI-41/2022
The Leibniz Institute for Natural Product Research and Infection Biology – Hans Knöll Institute – (Leibniz-HKI
column2: www.leibniz-hki.de) investigates the pathobiology of human-pathogenic fungi and identifies targets for the development of novel natural product-based antibiotics. Talented and highly qualified candidates are invited to apply for a position in the Department Bio Pilot Plant as a

column1: Scientific or technial assistant / (f/div/m) in Synthetic Biology or Biotechnology
for one year initially.
Research Areas: Molecular Biology
column2: Biochemistry
column4: Dictyostelium discoideum

column1: This project is part of a Federal Ministry for Education and Research (BMBF) funded research project which aims to develop the social amoeba Dictyostelium discoideum into a production platform for secondary metabolites of pharmaceutical importance..
The field of study:

The successful candidate will assist in the construction of multi-gene expression plasmids and the establishment of CRISPR/Cas tools for strain engineering of the social amoeba Dictyostelium discoideum and will help to develop methods to measure and enhance the production of heterologous secondary metabolites.
The main topics of the project may include:
• Metabolic engineering of D. discoideum to enhance the production of biochemical precursors for polyketide production
• High-throughput cultivations
column2: automated screening and processing of production strains of D. discoideum

• A bachelor or master degree in molecular biology

column1: Senior Associate Gene Therapy (m/f/d) in Penzberg;"Senior Associate Gene Therapy (m/f/d)
The Position
Senior Associate Gene Therpay (m/f/d)
In Roche's Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development organisation (pRED)
column2: we make transformative medicines for patients in order to tackle some of the world's toughest unmet healthcare needs. At pRED
column3: we are united by our mission to transform science into medicines. Together
column4: we create a culture defined by curiosity
column5: responsibility and humility
column6: where our talented people are empowered and inspired to bring forward extraordinary life-changing innovation at speed.

column1: Our vision is to create novel and highly differentiated medicines. To this end
column2: we discover and develop novel therapeutic antibodies and next generation biologics
column4: fusion proteins or AAV vectors for gene therapy. Our ambition is to deliver such novel molecules to patients with game changing clinical benefits.

column1: We are looking for a Senior Associate in Genomic Medicine (m/f/d) with a keen interest in the fields of drug discovery and development. You will join the department of Cell Technologies
column2: which belongs to a unit called Large Molecule Research within Roche Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED).

column1: This position therefore offers the opportunity to interact with numerous functions within Roche to deliver novel medicines to patients.
Your team in a nutshell:
You will be part of ambitious matrix teams
column2: which drive different projects of the Genomic Medicine in Therapeutic Modalities (TMo). These teams involve Roche colleagues with different expertise and level (e.g. students
column4: scientists and project managers). Each voice is valued and we highly appreciate the contribution of different perspectives that often leads to innovative solutions for our challenging projects.

column1: Job mission:

Your work focuses on development and application of methods for AAV vector generation for Gene Therapy. Hereby you will employ synthetic biology tools for cell engineering and recombinant AAV vector engineering. You have a strong background in molecular biology
column2: analytical methods
column4: you can establish methods that enable design-build-test-learn cycles for the development of advanced AAV vectors. Moreover
column5: you have strong organizational skills as you will be responsible for structuring and maintaining lab activities.

column1: Your impact:

DESIGN: You will design experiments for optimization of AAV-vectors and AAV-vector production systems (inclusive stable production cell lines) & workflows (including automated workflows) supported by using methodologies such as used in Synthetic Biology.
BUILD: You will apply cutting-edge technology to design and create plasmids and AAV vectors by either using internal capabilities or by using external suppliers.
TEST: You will use existing and establish new functional readouts
column2: e.g. dPCR
column4: reporter cell systems
column5: microfluidic systems and NGS for the characterization of AAV-vectors and AAV-vector production systems and workflows.

column1: LEARN: You will use state-of-the-art data analysis software to analyze and consolidate large data sets that support informed or AI-guided decision-making for the next design cycle.
You will be responsible to map standardized biological parts and process large data sets to fit into our IT infrastructure.
Your profile:
Team player: you are passionate about building strong teams. In your teams
column2: everyone shares the success while setbacks are viewed as an opportunity to learn. Besides
column3: you support temporary workers and / or interns.

column1: Communication and networking: You know how to proactively build bridges and how to network in a big organization
Being courageous: you tackle difficult issues with confidence and you hold things together during tough times
Organizational awareness: you see the big picture and have a clear understanding of other group's business needs
Continuous learning: you enjoy the challenges of unfamiliar tasks to continuously learn new things. You seek novel approaches to solve problems and to challenge the status quo.
Presentation skills: you know how to present in a clear and convincing way before big audiences and management boards
And the technical requirements for this position?
A strong background together with 2-3 years of professional experience in cutting-edge technologies for AAV-vector generation and biology
column2: cell engineering & synthetic biology is necessary for this position

column1: A Masters degree in biotechnology
column2: virology
column3: synthetic biology or similar area helps you to fulfill those tasks

column1: Expertise in methods for virus vector generation and characterization are required
Expertise in molecular biology (e.g. plasmid design
column2: DNA sequencing) and cell engineering (transfection
column4: gene shuffling) is required. Experience in the following techniques and readouts are desired: FACS analysis
column5: microfluidic devices
column6: cell culture automation

column1: Fluent English language skills are natural to you
Strong IT and data analysis skills are necessary
In principle
column2: this position is also suitable for part-time work.

column1: Postdoc Biology - membrane electron transport (m/f/d);"The Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research (UFZ) with its 1
column2: 100 employees has gained an excellent reputation as an international competence centre for environmental sciences. We are part of the largest scientific organisation in Germany
column3: the Helmholtz Association. Our mission: Our research seeks to find a balance between social development and the long-term protection of our natural resources. Hydrogen will play a key role in decarbonizing our society and sustaining our future. Biophotovoltaics (BPV)
column4: which exploits the natural oxygenic photosystem in a bioelectrochemcial system
column5: aims to deliver a sustainble solution for hydrogen production in the future. It provides unique benefits in terms of the energy and resource demands and also it can potentially make H2 production as a carbon-sink process since the oxygenic photomicroorganism (e.g. cyanobacteria) use CO2 as the carbon source for growth and maintenance. Within the newly BMBF funded Nachwuchsgruppenprojekt BioPV4H2
column6: we aim to gain a holistic understanding of the BPV process from both biological and technological aspects
column7: and thus to promote rational design and development of this technique for future application. To realize the proposed ambitious goals
column8: I am seeking an enthusiastic synthetic biologist to fill a full-time postdoc position funded by this project. The main task of this position is to engineer the membrane electron transfer pathways of cyanobacteria in BPV using synthetic biology tools
column9: in order to facilitate the electron transfer rate from the photosystem to the external electron sink. The successful candidate will have the support to establish and lead the synthetic biology platform in the group
column10: and will be strongly supported to develop his/her research profile for the next scientific career move
column11: including but not limited to further training
column12: international conference and networking. Postdoc position (m/f/x) on engineering the membrane electron transport pathway in Synechocystis Working time: 100% (39 hours per week)
column14: 2023 but can be discussed upon individual case. (The initial phase of employment will be 1 year
column15: and will be directly extended for another 3 years upon positive evaluation.) The successful candidate will develop and lead the synthetic biology platform
column16: and work closely with the PhD students and also our project partners (e.g. Prof. Victor de Lorenzo and Prof. Peter Lindblad) to drive the research progress of the respective working tasks. Particularly your tasks will include: Developing the synthetic biology methods for bacterial membrane protein expression and knock-down/out; Introducing heterologous membrane reductase to extract electrons from cellular electron transport chain; Characterizing the microbial physiology and behaviors; Communicating with our project partners and also involved in preparing the strategic plan of the project; Co-supervising PhD/Master/Bachelor students; Presenting project progress at international scientific conferences; Writing progress report
column17: and publishing project results in high-ranked scientific journals; PhD in molecular biology

column1: Group Leader – Structural or Molecular Systems Biology;"The Structural and Computational Biology (SCB) Unit at EMBL Heidelberg pursues an ambitious and cross-disciplinary research program in integrated structural and computational systems biology
column2: bridging between temporal and spatial scales. The SCB Unit seeks to recruit a highly motivated group leader in the area of structural or molecular systems biology to address fundamental questions in life sciences.

column1: Your role
Establish an independent and innovative research programme. The SCB Unit is interested in attracting candidates that pursue experimental or computational approaches
column2: which can contribute to or interface with integrated structural biology. Research areas can be diverse including chemical biology
column4: biophysics
column5: proteomics
column6: metabolomics
column8: modelling and simulation of biological systems. The research should extend or enrich structural systems biology
column9: a broad concept that the unit is pursuing
column10: in conjunction with a strong computational biology programme.

column1: In line with EMBL’s scientific programme from Molecules to Ecosystems
column2: the SCB Unit is also interested in candidates that have research programs related to EMBL’s transversal themes; for example
column3: the SCB Unit has already considerable strengths in Planetary Biology and Microbial Ecosystems. The future group leader will be embedded in the multidisciplinary and collaborative environment of EMBL
column4: which provides many opportunities for interaction with other research groups.

column1: You have
The ambition to work on fundamental biological questions
column2: which implies both
column3: biological discoveries or methodological advances. Furthermore
column4: your research complements and synergizes with the activities of the SCB Unit and the whole of EMBL. You should therefore demonstrate a strong motivation to work in the collaborative and multidisciplinary environment of EMBL.

column1: In addition
column2: you should be dedicated to develop effective relationships and to provide leadership and guidance to team members. The ability to work independently and to participate in a collaborative team effort is desirable
column3: as is a pro-active and positive problem-solving mind-set.

column1: You might also have
EMBL’s new program
column2: Molecules to Ecosystems
column3: includes a vision to advance our understanding of ecosystems at the molecular level
column4: applying expertise in molecular biology to study life in its natural context. New research areas will focus on applying experimental
column5: computational and theoretical approaches to study at multiple levels (molecules
column6: cells
column7: tissues and populations) how organisms interact with each other and respond to environmental change. SCB will be happy to host structural or molecular systems biology activities related to the new transversal themes.

column1: • Planetary Biology – aiming to understand how microbes
column2: plants
column3: and animals interact with each other and with their abiotic environments at the molecular level.

column1: • Microbial Ecosystems – studying microorganisms
column2: how they live in communities and interact with their environments

column1: • Infection Biology - unravelling new strategies to treat infections by studying pathogens
column2: their molecular machineries
column4: and their ability to spread in populations and across hosts.

column1: • Human Ecosystems – applying computational and experimental approaches to reveal the impact of the environment on human health and physiology
column2: both at the individual and the population level.

column1: • Theory – using modelling
column2: mathematical reasoning
column3: and conceptual approaches to study complex and dynamic biological systems.

column1: • Why join us

EMBL appoints group leaders from early on in their career and provides a very supportive environment for your first independent position in order to achieve your research goals. The initial ""Lead your Lab"" management training is provided for all incoming group leaders.

The SCB Unit at EMBL offers access to an outstanding integrated structural biology environment that includes a particularly well equipped cryo-electron microscopy facility. The Unit also interacts closely with the EMBL Imaging Centre that offers access to a broad spectrum of electron and light microscopy technologies with special emphasis on correlative approaches. Further information about research in the SCB Unit and at EMBL can be found at the EMBL web page.
EMBL is curiosity-driven
column2: community-oriented and international. As an inclusive
column4: we believe that diversity enables us to collaborate more effectively and be innovative in our approaches. We are
column5: therefore
column6: committed to creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation.

column1: We encourage applications from individuals who can complement our existing team – we believe that success is built on having teams whose backgrounds and personal experiences reflect the diversity of the populations that our science serves. We actively encourage applications from all genders and cultures
column2: ethnic groups and all demographics to help us avoid perpetuating biases and oversights at this transformational point in our people strategy.

column1: EMBL offers attractive conditions and benefits appropriate to an international research organisation with a very collegial and family-friendly working environment. Competitive salary and social security benefits
column2: financial support for relocation
column4: professional development
column5: an on-site nursery
column6: canteen and other staff facilities make EMBL a great place to work.

column1: What else you need to know
We are Europe’s flagship research laboratory for the life sciences – an intergovernmental organisation performing scientific research in disciplines including molecular biology
column2: physics
column3: chemistry and computer science. We are an international
column4: innovative and interdisciplinary laboratory with more than 1800 employees from more than 80 countries
column5: operating across six sites
column6: in Heidelberg (HQ)

column1: Molecular Biologists - Synthetic Biology
column2: Biochnology (m/f/d);The Leibniz Institute for Natural Product Research and Infection Biology - Hans Knöll Institute - (Leibniz-HKI
column3: ) investigates the pathobiology of human-pathogenic fungi and identifies targets for the development of novel natural product-based antibiotics. Talented and highly qualified candidates are invited to apply for a position in the Department Bio Pilot Plant as a Scientific or technical assistant (f/div/m) in Synthetic Biology or Biotechnology for one year initially. Research Areas: Molecular Biology
column4: Biochemistry
column5: Biotechnology
column6: Dictyostelium discoideum This project is part of a Federal Ministry for Education and Research (BMBF) funded research project which aims to develop the social amoeba Dictyostelium discoideum into a production platform for secondary metabolites of pharmaceutical importance. The successful candidate will assist in the construction of multi-gene expression plasmids and the establishment of CRISPR/Cas tools for strain engineering of the social amoeba Dictyostelium discoideum and will help to develop methods to measure and enhance the production of heterologous secondary metabolites. The main topics of the project may include: Metabolic engineering of D. discoideum to enhance the production of biochemical precursors for polyketide production High-throughput cultivations
column7: automated screening and processing of production strains of D. discoideum A bachelor or master degree in molecular biology
column10: biotechnology or related discipline. Candidates about to obtain their degree are welcome to apply. A basic experimental background in molecular cloning and microbiology. The candidate should be highly interested in applied
column11: translational research and able to work in an international
column12: interdisciplinary research team. The successful candidate will be part of the ProDICAN research project led by Prof. Dr. Falk Hillmann. The aim of the group is to conduct innovative
column13: cutting-edge research on amoebae as a new host organism for the production of plant-derived natural products. The Leibniz-HKI is embedded in the outstanding scientific environment of the Beutenberg Campus providing state-of-the-art research facilities and a highly integrative network of life science groups. We offer a multifaceted scientific project with excellent technical facilities
column16: as well as strong scientific collaborations. Salary is paid according to German TV-L (salary agreement for public service employees). As an equal opportunity employer
column17: the Leibniz-HKI is committed to increasing the percentage of female scientists and therefore especially encourages them to apply;Leibniz Institute for Natural Product Research and Infection Biology e.
